episodes.title: Epstein Files Released: Survivor Marina Lacerda Urges Full Transparency, Says 'Stop Redacting Names'
episodes.description:
The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) has begun releasing documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, but many of the files remain incomplete, with numerous names redacted. The release of these files has sparked outrage, particularly from survivors like Marina Lacerda, who has publicly identified herself as one of Epstein's victims.

Lacerda, who was abused by Epstein starting at the age of 14, has been a vocal advocate for transparency and accountability. After reviewing the documents, she called for the DOJ to stop redacting names that don’t need to be hidden, stating, "Just put out the files and stop redacting names that don't need to be redacted." While the files provide further insight into Epstein's extensive network of powerful connections, the incomplete release leaves many questions unanswered. Lacerda and other survivors continue to demand full disclosure to ensure justice is served and to help the public better understand the full extent of Epstein's abuse. The release of these files comes after years of legal battles and public outcry. Survivors like Lacerda are pushing for a more open and transparent process to ensure that the truth is fully revealed.
#epsteinfiles #epstein #departmentofjustice
